title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Williamsburg, Brooklyn

content.rendered:
In recent years, Williamsburg has become a pop-culture hub and a powerhouse in shaping NYC trends. Many key films and books depicting life in Brooklyn in the 1900s have been set in the neighborhood. Are you planning to move to this trendy neighborhood? Well, before making the big move, here’s your neighborhood guide covering all the key info. Keep it handy for details on average rent and restaurants in Williamsburg that will make your search for rooms for rent in Williamsburg much easier.

1. Where is Williamsburg?

Williamsburg is a neighborhood in the northwestern portion of the New York City borough of Brooklyn. While the coastline offers spectacular vistas of Manhattan and seasonal sites for outdoor concerts and food markets, street art illuminates residential thoroughfares and restored industries. Both native New Yorkers and newcomers to the city love this area’s unique vibes, numerous dining options, and easy access to public transportation.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In East Bronx

2. Find Rooms For Rent in Williamsburg

Find Rooms For Rent In Williamsburg, Brooklyn

Walk-up apartments and row homes are popular in central Williamsburg, but luxury high-rises and condos dot the waterfront. As a resident, you’ll experience a dense urban feel. Many households are made up of families and elite professionals who rent their homes. Moreover, the neighborhood offers a lot of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks. Also, you can easily find a roommate to help you save money on your basic living expenses.

3. Average Rent in Williamsburg

While the buying and the rental markets are becoming increasingly competitive, great value properties are still available. These days, prices and new projects attract a constant stream of working professionals seeking rooms for rent in Williamsburg with its amazing view of Manhattan’s skyline.

4. Is Williamsburg safe?

Before moving to this new place, you might wonder, ‘is Williamsburg safe’? For starters, the neighborhood is served and patrolled by the 90th Precinct of the NYPD.

Here are a few apps that provide useful neighborhood insights that make the process of finding rooms for rent in Williamsburg hassle-free. Download them before your visit and get access to vital information — all for free!

  • Niche: This site provides a comprehensive, neighborhood-specific report. It elaborates on various rankings, safety rates, education, real estate and resident reviews.
  • NextDoor: The best way to keep updated about what’s going on in your area is to use NextDoor. It’s a private social network for your neighborhood, where you can exchange safety tips, report suspicious activities, and even arrange a last-minute babysitter.
  • AroundMe: AroundMe does a great job of helping you find nearby hospitals, supermarkets, pharmacies, and more. Also, it gives you current pricing, directions, and more to help you make a quick choice. It’s an essential app to refer to while looking for rooms for rent in Williamsburg.
  • Hotline Numbers: 911 and 311 are the two helpful numbers New York residents use to get info or for emergencies. Basically, 311 is a type of citizens’ hotline. You can call to report issues like abandoned vehicles, road repairs, noise complaints, and graffiti. By adding a second channel for citizens to report problems, 911 operators are free to address legitimate emergencies.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Jerome Park

5. Public Transit in Williamsburg

1. Walkability

This neighborhood is the 41st most walkable neighborhood in New York, with a Walk Score of 96. Many also use the Williamsburg Bridge as an easy route into the city, by walking, running, or cycling for their morning commute. When you live in this area your daily errands don’t require a car – you can easily get them done on foot.

2. Roads & Traffic

Williamsburg spans a huge area of the northwestern portion of Brooklyn. It can get loud at times due to the rush, but it’s nothing you won’t get used to in time. You might even come to appreciate the hustle and bustle that brings the city to life!

3. Nearby Train Stations

Being familiar with transit options can help you save time when you’re looking for rooms for rent in Williamsburg. The L train takes residents right into the heart of Manhattan at 14th St., and the M and J trains make it easy to get to other downtown neighborhoods.

Related: A Guide To NYC’s Subway Trains

4. Nearby Bus Stops

The Williamsburg Bridge Plaza is a major bus (and former trolley) terminal located at the foot of the bridge. It’s one block west of the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway (I-278). Check all bus routes prior to moving to make sure they’ve got you covered.

6. Restaurants in Williamsburg

You’re bound to work up an appetite while you’re out and about looking for rooms for rent in Williamsburg. So, don’t forget to explore some of the many restaurants in the neighborhood. There’s a solid mix of established restaurants in Williamsburg, plus some fresh new options, and with limited wait times, it’s easy to become a regular!

1. Sunday In Brooklyn

This spot is a must-try when it comes to restaurants in Williamsburg. Their menu sports a wide variety of dishes, including roasted cauliflower dip with black sesame tahini, confit garlic, and buckwheat cracker; spicy togarashi fried chicken; and some Instagram-worthy malted pancakes at brunchtime.

Website

2. Sobre Masa

Sobre Masa is one of the greatest restaurants in Williamsburg! The colorful exterior and sidewalk seating of this brand-new Oaxacan restaurant, which opened in the middle of the pandemic, offer amazing dishes!

Website
Order

3. Aska

If you’re looking for diners for special occasions, there aren’t many restaurants in Williamsburg that compare to this one. Seasonal Scandinavian tasting menus include fermented and smoked tastes in abundance. Aska is a great place to visit after a day spent searching for rooms for rent in Williamsburg.

Website

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn

7. Parks in Williamsburg

In addition to the variety of rooms for rent in Williamsburg, this neighborhood also boasts some attractive outdoor spaces. There are some gorgeous greenways where you can enjoy some exciting recreational activities as well.

While you’re in the neighborhood, be sure to check out:

  • Brooklyn Botanic Garden
  • McCarren Park
  • Grand Ferry Park
  • North 5th Street Pier and Park
  • Bushwick Inlet Park

Related: Things To Do In Brooklyn With Your Roommates!

8. Nightlife in Williamsburg

Chic clubs and popular dive pubs with rear patios make up the nightlife scene here. Many long-time neighbors are satisfied with down-home pubs like Turkey’s Nest Tavern.

The music scene in Williamsburg attracts visitors from all five boroughs. Smaller venues like Shea Stadium are at the heart of the do-it-yourself music industry, while larger venues like Brooklyn Bowl or Music Hall of Williamsburg draw big-name artists. Punk, rock, and experimental lovers may enjoy live performers in a more intimate setting here.

Williamsburg awaits you. Happy moving!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Williamsburg? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
